attributes.comment:
I am making a comment about the proposal to raise fees on all adoption proceedings,(I-600,
citizenship certrificate fee, fingerprints,etc..). To raise these already high fees 66% is utterly
ridiculous! I have adopted 5 times internationally and we usually adopt sibling groups and with fees
increasing that much it would be hard to cover that high of an expense. Most of us who adopt are
not rich and work very hard to raise or save up the money for our adoptions to help give children a
loving home. A small increase I can understand but the increases you are proposing are utterly so
expensive. Is this increase happening so that you might deter people from adopting
internationally? Unfortunately, if this is so, there will be many kids who will never have a loving
home with any body, because adopting stateside is not as easy as they make it sound. Taking
years to get a child into the adoptive home. I think raising these fees should be reconsidered. What
is constituting such a high raise anyway? Is somebody's government pocket not getting enough
money in it? This proposal really disgust me. what's the deal here?
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Debra Carter
